title: Is the profanity filter different in the Alpha Client than it was in the Legacy Client?

replies.body:
With the profanity filter off in the new client, I can see profanity in the client only. 

But ingame, it's censored for me.

Have you tried disabling the language filter by hitting the *cog* icon in the top right of the client, then uncheck the box under *Chat & Friends*? Below is a screenshot showing what I'm talking about:

https://imgur.com/a/odOW9

Let me know if this helped!

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pUcmKJsh,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-22T00:33:09.743+0000)
>
> Have you tried disabling the language filter by hitting the *cog* icon in the top right of the client, then uncheck the box under *Chat & Friends*? Below is a screenshot showing what I'm talking about:
> 
> https://imgur.com/a/odOW9
> 
> Let me know if this helped!

Yes, I have. But even though I go to the settings, disable it and press "Done", it is still enabled when I open settings again.

And about those "normal words". For example: "mie" (finnish dialect word for "I"), "muista" (finnish word for "remember") and even something so mundane as "59k" gets sensored. "60k" etc. is fine by the system, though.

UPDATE: it seems like the system is not blocking ／人◕ ‿‿ ◕人＼ anymore.

UPDATE#2: Welp! Only "Chat & Friends"-settings cannot be changed at all. Everything else works as intended.
Which words is the system still blocking and is this in-game or out of game?

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=pUcmKJsh,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-11-22T21:39:15.348+0000)
>
> Which words is the system still blocking and is this in-game or out of game?

In-game it seems like it's turned off. But if I message someone or if I receive messages in client, it appears to be on. Anyways, it still shows enabled in settings.
So every time you disable it and hit the *Done* button, the change is reverted when you go back in the settings to check if it was disabled?

Yes. Although it doesn't seem to disable it in the first Place. It still puts asterisks over all "offensive words" even if I don't re-open the settings window. ONLY the "Chat & Friends"  tab reverts itself. I  sent a bug report about this via in-client button.

Also a little off-topic: since the filter blocks really many things, I would like to know why is "59k" changed into "\***" but for example "60k" stays as it is. Who's responsibility is it to put stuff into the filter's blacklist anyways?

Yeah, a bug report was probably the best way to address this. It is a Beta after all. :P

I honestly don't know who specifically decides what words are added to the language blacklist, but I'm confident it's someone on the New Client Team. Because I'm not on that team, I can't provide you reasons why specific words are blocked while others aren't. :/

Let me know if you have any other questions.

there are actually some ridiculous filter in the new client for words like "cos", "demonstrate", and a few other basic ones that slip my mind right now. 

Never really understood why those words are filtered.

>"demonstrate"

Seriously? As in "Riot" (capital R applied deliberately)? Well played, Tencent! xD

Well, I guess that makes it official then: it's only Tencent now.
